knowledge_zone.heading: Suspense: Creates meaning in the text

sections.content: Suspense is used throughout the text to creates meaning in the text.

examples.quote: Tom Robinson had come to a dead stop
examples.scene: Tom hesitates before revealing the most damaging part of his testimony
examples.effect: Creates anticipation about Tom's revelation, building climactic tension as the child narrator approaches the moment of ultimate moral truth

examples.quote: I hear it when we're walkin' along
examples.scene: Jem realizes they're being followed on the dark walk home
examples.effect: Building tension through mysterious sounds creates dramatic anticipation while child narrator doesn't fully grasp the mortal danger approaching

pedagogy_zone.heading: From Device Spotting to Analysis
pedagogy_zone.intro_text: Most students can identify a device. Strong analysis shows what it DOES. Don't just label it—explain its function in creating meaning.

content.question: Ask yourself: Why does the author use Suspense HERE? What meaning does it create in this specific moment?
content.framework: Use TVODE: Technique → Verb → Observation → Device effect → Evaluation

pedagogy_zone.essay_application: In your essays, always connect device to meaning. Show HOW the technique creates the effect, don't just identify that it's there.
